We had the tasting menu.  The food was plated very nicely and sounded very creative/adventurous.  Clearly some risks being taken.  Reminded me a lot of Saison aspirationally, but the dishes don't come together nearly as well (or in some cases, at all).

As some of the people below note, the issue was flavor.  The dishes just weren't seasoned and balanced very well.  We had a salmon belly with a vegetable jelly and bright green sauce that completely overwhelmed the dish (think wheatgrass, though not that strong). The fish (halibut) was a bit overcooked and no acid at all on the dish, so it was pretty bland.  Had the lamb with porcinis and porcini puree: the lamb chops were good, the roasted porcinis very good, but again the dish just didn't really come together.

On the upside, desert was pretty good.  In particular, had a buckwheat ice cream which was far and away my favorite taste of the night.  

Current plan is not to go back, but the place was cool enough that I'll check the reviews here in 3 months or so and give it another shot if they seem to improve.
author: r h.

description: Tasting menu is the only way to enjoy it.  Unique outdoor ambiance in an indoor place.
author: Tina N.

description: Ambiance good. Food ok. Better quality can be found at the farmers market. The dishes were made of interesting ingredient combos, but they didn't really taste as good as they seemed on the menu. Great menu writer, and average chefs.
author: Shomace I.

description:
Tried this restaurant earlier this week for my birthday dinner.  There were 5 of us and we opted to do the Tasting Menu, which was fantastic!

We were seated right away (we had an 8:30 ressie) and the place didn't really seem crowded.  The big communal table was near us and there were only 2 people at the very end for most of our nearly 3 hour dinner experience.

The ambience was cool, although a few people in my party thought it was a little chilly due to the inside/outside aspect of the restaurant. 

We decided not to do the wine pairings with the Tasting Menu and just choose wine on our own, especially since 2 of us had to drive after dinner.  The Tasting menu was fantastic.  I'm fairly picky and there was nothing they served that I didn't truly enjoy.  With that said, I will agree with other reviewers that the portions are slightly smaller than one might expect -- but that's not necessarily a bad thing!  It was nice to leave a multi-course dinner and not feel stuffed!

They also have plenty of hot, gourmet bread that they will keep bringing until you cut them off (yes, I judge restaurants on their bread once in a while) so if you're worried about being hungry just eat more of that!

Overall I thought it was the perfect dinner experience -- it was trendy, a new place I wanted to try and fantastic food.  That said, I don't think I'll be hurrying back anytime soon but only because it is a little pricey and there are already so many other restaurants on my list to try!
author: Keeley S.

description: 6 of us were seated for dinner last weekend....the waiter came to take our order and proceeded NOT to write it down....I turned to him and asked him why he wasnt writing it down and that it was a big order to remember....Next thing we know, 1 of us was left sitting with no appetiser. such a amateur mistake from a very expensive restaurant....So annoying
author: John S.

description: The service was great. I asked a chef about a dish and that looked amazing and he brought the dish to our table. The food was also delicious. I was very impressed all the way around.
author: Yohanes F.

description:
I wasn't overly impressed with Central Kitchen.  We had a group of four, and decided not to do the tasting menu, but instead to order one of everything from the savory menu (comes out to 9 dishes) for the table. The food was good, but not mind blowing, and the portions are super small.     
The service, however, was fantastic.  Our server was very knowledgeable with both the menu and the wine list.  The place is also very loud!  If you are seated underneath a speaker, it will be hard to hear the person sitting across from you.  We did ask if they could turn the music down a little bit, which they did for about 45 minutes before the volume went up again.  Aside from that, I liked the ambiance and the general feel of the restaurant.  I really wanted to be blown away by this place, but I ended up leaving feeling that is was just okay.
author: Erin S.

description: Central Kitchen is better than ever! We "let the kitchen decide" and received five fabulous courses with exquisite wine pairings. Service was outstanding!
author: Frances M.

description: Expensive and mediocre for brunch, which doesn't tempt me to try for dinner. Pleasant ambiance and attentive service. Agree with other reviewers that the music (at brunch) is over the top loud. The stacked wood outside looked promising. Too bad.
author: Baloo C.

description: flavor was good, but did not impress me. small portion. service was good. too pricey to me and I wont want to go back.
author: Paiyu G.

description: Word to the wise (manager/owner of restaurant): when you are trying to be a fancy restaurant with difficult-to-get reservations, if part of a party with a reservation arrives on time and *slightly* before the rest of the party, AND you have MANY empty tables, you SEAT THOSE PEOPLE and offer them wine and drinks before the rest of the party arrives.  this is not the kind of drop-in place where you need to make sure no one flakes out before seating people.  I was immediately put off by this and it spoiled my perception of the service, which was friendly and informed overall but kinda slow, to be honest.  Food excellent.  Don't shoot yourself in the foot with stupid attitudinal policies.  It's not helping your business model.
author: Em P.

description: Showed up for our reservation at 8:30pm on time and ready to be fed.  Hostess continued to make excuses until we finally got seated at 10:45pm.  Upon being seated we asked if the food will take as long as it took to get seated, and they responded NO!  I stayed unil 11:45pm and still no food arrived at the table.  I left the restaurant hungry, lied too and pissed off.  They clearly do not have the experience to serve the community and should close their doors and open up a food truck instead.  I will never return to this establishment and I suggest you avoid this place as well.
author: Phil M.

description:
Walked in and was seated as soon as we arrived per our reservation time.  The hostess asked about water preference so wasn't sure if she was the hostess or our server.  Another person took our drink order.  Then the hostess came back with the wine bottle we selected and presented my husband to try the selection when I was the one who ordered it.  That should have foreshadowed our service for the remainder of the meal. Unless prompted, we had no direction from our server about what her recommendations were, etc.  

Food was delicious and we were pleased with everything we ordered, but felt like I could have gone to the counter and ordered our meal because there was no service for the prices we were paying.  When you charge $30 for what is actually your 4th course - there is a level of service expected with that price.  We filled all of our wine ourselves and when we finished the bottle, when the server finally came around she picked up the bottle to pour and it was empty, made a comment "it makes me sad when a bottle is empty" which I think was meant to be a joke, but then she cleared the glasses, took the bottle and never came back.  A missed opportunity to offer another glass to order.  It took about 10 minutes to clear our plates, we had to ask for dessert menu and then they gave us the same menu with no dessert listed.  Didn't bother to ask because they literally gave us the menus and walked off.  We waited another 10 mins to just tell the waiter we wanted our bill.  It was just bad service.  Our waiter walked by our table twice when we were sitting there with empty plates, no drinks, nothing.  It was like she was surveying the room, but not sure what she was surveying because we blatantly were overlooked.  Food was great, but for the service, I'd rather go to the plentiful other options in the city for dinner.
author: B. K.

description: Super tasty but just not worth the super priciness. Also aggressively loud background music. You have to shout over it to be heard. It's like the restaurant is a frustrated club.
author: Aiko S.

description: Industrial-chic decor in out of the way neighborhood, but worth the trip.  Service was memorable--one of the few waiters with enough humor and patience to put up with my date.  I want to say the food was amazing, but now months on I can't remember exactly what we had, but it was good.  Ce la vie.
author: Mary C.

description: Expensive dishes with small portions. And with the highest Healthy S.F. fee I've seen so far - $2.50 per person?! What is this restaurant's management doing? How do they justify this?
author: M M.

description: Headed there this week, heard the portions are embarrassingly small though (3 different groups I know went to eat somewhere after). Hopefully they find a way to address that issue.  Stay tuned.
author: J A.

description: We had a wonderful dinner here.  A very friendly space, thoughtfully prepared food with fresh ingredients and a wait staff that was attentive and incredibly knowledgeable about the menu, both food and wine.  The deviled eggs, tuna, hen and the chocolate custard were all winning recommendations!  And I can't wait to go back!
author: Mark G.

description: i love central kitchen!  the decor is so romantic, the service is top notch and the food is exquisite.  i took my father there for father's day this year and he's not someone who is easily impressed by things that are just for show.  he thought the food was out of this world and that's saying a lot coming from my dad : ) i live in the neighborhood, down the street literally, and am so happy to have this restaurant here.  central kitchen has definitely become my "we're celebrating a special occasion" place and it seems like i've been celebrating special occasions a lot lately : )
author: Naomi S.

description: The wait staff was friendly and the space is really great but the food was not tasty (I don't recommend the halibut which tastes surprisingly like shrimp cocktail) and the portions are small.
author: Kristen H.

description: Fantastic food - every dish we had was great, and the wait staff was really helpful - good at explaining the alternatives, and attentive to the table.  If there were only two of you, I'd say it was 5 stars.  But, there were 4 of us, and the noise level is so high that you can't hear someone speak on the diagonal side of the table unless you're staring right at them and reading their lips.
author: Donald L.

description: They are really rude to customers here.   They wanted my very pregnant partner to perch on a bar stool, and wouldn't let her sit at any of the dozen empty tables.  I just wont eat at places run by jerks like that any more.
author: Matthew V.

description:
If someone asked me to recommend a place to take someone out for a nice date this would be my pick (they have a great bar right next door, it's a lovely neighborhood and the ambiance within is really pleasant.)
The food? Central Kitchen is quite good: I think the best thing about them is the novel flavor combinations. In relation to what you get, they are on the expensive side. Hence, I suggest you pick a few appetizers and a glass of wine (staff is really good at pairing.) It keeps the price under control and you try more things. 
My sense is that they are always experimenting with the menu. Some items are almost mind-blowing; others are just OK. Ask your waiter what they've kept in the menu the longest and you can't go wrong. For example, they have a pate (I can't find the right accents for "pate" on this computer) that they bring in a mason jar that is worth returning for.
In my experience the place is busy but it's not particularly hard to get seated.
author: D Z.

description: It was AMAZING! Probably the best food I've ever tried in SF. We tried the liver mousse, the tonnato delivered eggs, the pork loin and the rabbit - they were all delicious, the rabbit was almost melting in my mouth! And the dessert - well, if I could have their chocolate custard once a month, i would quit with all desserts in the rest of the days. :)
author: Nora N.

description: I'm glad this place opened in the neighborhood, unfortunately, I don't think I'll return.  The food is not bad - in fact some of the dishes were quite good (the halibut was delicious). The room is nice though a bit boring.  The service was pretty good and attentive.  The portions were a bit small.  I thought our meal was expensive for what we got. Value for money = 2 stars
author: Alan T.

description: Attended a private party over the weekend in the deli room. Great ambiance. Service was superb and food was amazing!!! The chef created an absolutely creative and delicious menu for our party. And he went above and beyond by customizing the menu with delicious options for two of the diners with special food preferences. Definitely a happening place - no wonder.
author: J L.

description: Ambiance was nice, the food was decent but for the price we could have had much better. The servers worked like a team which initially was confusing but we caught on, I like the idea but I wish somebody would have mentioned it so i didnt wait 10 minutes to see my waiter again.
author: Ciaran D.

description: Stay away ! The service is okay.. We love Flour and Water but here you get very low return for your $$$. The food was okay, nothing too fancy. Very disappointing.
author: Amir K.

description: Enjoyed the brunch here.  I devoured the bread pudding.  I tried the slow cooked egg and crispy hen and the soft scrambled eggs.  Both were delicious but if I had to choose one I'd go with the egg & hen.
author: Amber R.

description: This is a weird one for me because I was a tad underwhelmed by the food (duck and steak just OK, though ginger cake thing was great) but enjoyed the experience so much that I would definitely come back. We loved the open kitchen, the dim lighting, the yummy wine pairings, and our lovely waitress. Overall, a charming and relaxing Friday night.
author: Midori S.

description: Went for brunch.  Food was hit or miss.  Sticky bun was good, not great.  very sweet so split among the table.  Scrambled eggs were completely devoid of flavor, but the olive tapanade toast it came with was excellent.  Brisket and eggs; again, the eggs were bland, but the brisket was fantastic.    Side sausage was ok, side potatoes were very good.  Overall this was much pricier than it should have been given the flavor experience and portions.  After splitting a sticky bun among 3, then each getting a full dish AND each getting a side we still went straight out for ice cream.  I would suggest to my friends try it out, but only after a trying number of other brunch places and I would warn everyone not to get their hopes up.  Given their brunch, Im unlikely to go for dinner.
author: jonathan s.

description:
I came here for my birthday. So much to love about this place: 
1. The ambiance is perfect. I sat near the open kitchen area and was able to look out to the rest of the restaurant. I loved the lighting, wood, water fountain. One of the staff mentioned they were surprised it was this busy for a Monday, and he was right, every table was full. 
2. Service. I know other people thought the staff was not friendly, but my server was awesome. Attentive, helpful and gave good recommendations. When she wasn't stopping by, other staff were coming by pouring water, passing bread, etc. 
3. Food. Ok this is why we eat out right? We got four items to share between the 2 of us. The server says the menu changes all the time and recommended the summer squash. We got some squid, hen and an avocado starter. Everything was perfect and it was more than enough to share for 2. Dessert was a apple fritter and it was the most delicious apple fritter I ever had. 

Definitely a place to go.
author: Colleen D.

description:
Went there last night for our monthly "ladies who dine" meal.  From the outside this place is easy to miss. The door is on 20th and there's no sign, just the menu on the door.  That was fine by us, even after walking by twice.  But once you walk inside, you're suddenly transported to an oasis.  The first section is an open air seating, I'm thinking this is the open seating as well.  One communal table and about 5-6 smaller tables.  On the other side of the glass wall is the inside tables with a small bar (about 6 stools) and an open kitchen.  
The menu:  Good selection of items.  We ordered almost one of everything.  The asparagus two ways and the goat cheese curds and whey were SO yummy.  I wish I could have swam around in the bowl of whey (who knew it was so good?).  For mains we did order one of everything.  The salmon was a bit undercooked for my friends (although their plates were cleaned so...), the lamb was amazing (an attack on your senses, with a little curry-esk sauce on the veggies and lamb itself), and the duck was perfection.  Dessert, again we ordered one of everything.  Yep, again, very well done.  Each dish had something unique to it that made you go hummmm.....but in a good way.
Staff:  AWESOME.  They were very friendly, answered any questions you had, attentive but overly so.   
Price: All the food plus 4 glasses of wine, coffees and corkage for the bottle we brought =  $62 per person (table of 5, not including tip) 
The only negative was that when I called for a reservation they offered me a 6pm on Tuesday.  I called back 30 minutes later to be told that was taken and could only seat us at 5:45.  A bit early but figured we should grab it, knowing how hard Flour & Water is to get into.  It might be because it was a Tuesday and a bit cold, but the dinning room had a table for 5 open the whole time we were there (the other tables for 2 and 4 plus the bar were busy), and the outside area was pretty open as well.  I'm thinking they were just trying to create buzz.  It won't stop me from coming back.
author: Christina B.

description: Recently took my lady here for her birthday. The Ambiance was great! Order as much as you can and share. Very delicious food! I recommend the beat salad.
author: Dan J.

description: Went here for brunch. Incredible! Get two of the sticky bun, and all of the egg dishes are amazing. I had the baked eggs with chorizo and sweet potato- perfectly seasoned! The service was great. I was gulping down water because I was feeling dehydrated and yet my water glass seemed to always be full. I will definitely be back here again for Sunday brunch!
author: Sandile H.

description: I don't ever give 5 stars, but this one really is. They provide impeccable service, the food is prepared by well experienced chefs with a passion for creating an unforgettable food experience. The restaurant is modern, simplistic but tasteful in design. They even made certain my 3 year-old had a unique dinning experience. Reservations are hard to get. We were fortunate to dine with a friend who got a last minute reservation after meeting one of the restaurant investors. Plan ahead and go. We will be making a second reservation soon.
author: Shauntinez J.

description: I've now eaten here twice and I have to say my experiece has been the same both times.  The food is definitely expensive, and maybe a bit overpriced for portion size and seems a bit pretentious - but I think the reason others and I felt that way is because the service sucks!  Both times I had snooty, arrogant waiters, who nearly died when we decided to share dishes.....!  The second occasion we were in a large party, and though he topped up the wine in an overkill fashion, had problems getting the bare essentials like bread to the table.  I really love the decor and the feel of the restaurant, but much prefer to hang out next door at Trick Dog, I can't see anyone convincing me to go back......so disappointed.  I read the other reviews and it looks like I'm not the only one who feels the same, maybe the service is hit or miss, but one would expect a maitre d' to at least check in.
author: Kate G.

description: Had heard a lot about this place and loved their sister restaurant Flour & Water so gave it a try.  We really love the decor and vibe of the place; clean lines, yet warmth. The food was really interesting and tasty. It's artistic with flavor combinations you have to imagine and when the food finally comes it's fabulous.  We especially loved the crispy kale with mushroom and preserved lemon aioli. The crunch with the vege with the aioli was yummy and nothing greasy or too breaded.  Sunchoke salad with pear, prune, coffee & curds was a medley of flavors you'd never expect with great texture.  Highlight of the night was the crab with brussel leaves. It had super crunch and flavor, the portion was ample. Great for anyone loving their greens!  Disappointment for the evening was the swordfish with mussels, potato and fennel. It was a little mushy/soft - marshmallowy. Flavors were good but the texture was really off especially if you like your swordfish more 'steak like' - it's a meaty fish but it tasted uber poached.  The pork dish was terrific; tenderloin is never my thing because it's always a little lean and tough but there's was ok and the sausage on the plate terrific.  All in all we'd try it again. I don't know if I"d make it my neighborhood hangout - it's not the type of place you go to over and over again but it's definitely worth a visit or two or three.  Our servers were great; spacing between courses a little off (read long) but overall nothing to wreck about.  A really fun night. We all enjoyed this place. Also, they have a wonderful wine selection.
author: A C S.

description: I decided to try this restaurant since I love Flour + Water. The space is beautiful and the wine list has a lot of boutique local wineries that deserve more attention. As a vegetarian, this place wasn't for me. I don't find a huge plate of root vegetables to be an appetizing and satisfying meal. That said, all the meat eaters I went with loved this place!
author: arielle r.

description: Love this place!    Good luck getting in, but when you do it's awesome.   A little pricey but worth it.
author: Jamie S.

description: I won't be back. Microscopic portions. Funky tastes. Pickle it! Six, count them, brussels sprout leaves on one of my courses! Silly. Stupidly expensive. High technique in service of bad ideas. I could describe other courses but why bother. High noise level.. How can you mess up a fresh porcini mushroom? Criminal food abuse. By the way, what's a hen? A female bird of some sort I assume. Perhaps they mean chicken? They left the section headings off the menus, so your server will need to tell you which items are appetizers and which are main courses. Can't imagine how small an appetizer might be. Two stars is being generous.
author: Anthony D.

description: So we went for dinner here last night.We had no reservations and were told the wait time would be 45 mins (it was actually  11/2 hours) but it was a sat night . We loved the decor and ambiance although the music was just a little too loud.We ordered the tasting menu without the wine pairing.Some of thecourses were delicious,the halibut was perfectly executed.The salmon belly was not .We had about 7 waiters approximately ,maybe 8 and half way through our food courses we started to get the wine pairings.We let the waiter know and he kindly continued to pour and then go look for the reminder of the bottle of wine we ordered.On a positive note I think it has alot of potential and just needs a little fine tuning.
author: catherine O.

description: I hate to agree with the "small portions" "overpriced" complaints... but I kind of agree here.  food was good, wish there was more of it.  deserts were awesome.  service was very friendly.  good dinner... wouldn't go back
author: Brent C.

description: This was such a disappointing experience that I've come out of Yelp retirement to write about it.  As other reviewers have noted, the portions are tiny.  The space is lovely, woodsy, and airy- it almost feels like you're somewhere up Napa or Sonoma and not in the Mission.  And the staff was really nice and attentive.  But the food?  BLEEECCHHHH!!! It's hard to screw up morel mushrooms, but somehow they managed to do so. They were spongy and mixed up in some quinoa-based hippie gruel that tasted like something I could have picked up at Rainbow for six dollars.  Grilled lettuce?  Not so much.  Really, the only thing that was good was the dessert (lemon cake with berries and yogurt mousse), and that was just OK.  On the basis of the food alone, I'd give it one star but for the ambiance I'll bump it to two...reluctantly.  Stick to flour + water.
author: Vose S.

description: Hubs and I came here for our wedding anniversary, and we ordered the tasting menu. The food was tasty, and abundant (rare for tasting menus). So why the three stars?  Service.  Some servers were experienced and able to give us lots of information about what we were eating, others seemed to know very little (e.g., "this is halibut and mussels." What is this red sauce? "I don't know, let me find out." This would happen when there were more than 5 components to the dish, and they would tell us just one or two items. Ditto on the wine pairing, they'd basically just read the label.) Also, the service slowed WAY down in the second half of the meal, so much so, that I just wanted to leave. Like 20+ minutes between courses.  That added up to a 3+ hour meal, where even though the food was quite tasty, I left feeling annoyed, rather than delighted.  Which is a shame. McNaughton's "flour+water" restaurant has exceptionally knowedgeable and speedy service, so we were really surprised. So, I'd say, go for the food, and don't be in a rush, and hope to get a server who is experienced.
author: H A.

description: Nice space and good food, but disastrous music policy...we sat down to what we expected to be a great, candle lit meal only to find that a full length Rolling Stones album was blaring out of speakers mounted just a few feet above our table.  When I complained, the server acknowledged they hadn't been doing well with their music, but they didn't change it.  It created an ambiance more consistent with a college sports bar than a high end mission restaurant.  What I found most bizarre is that our server--who was I think more or less in agreement with our opinion about the music-- said that they didn't think of the restaurant as a "fine dining" establishment.  The implication was that they were trying to make it less stuffy with a rock and roll sound track.  IMO, they are underselling themselves.  The food was very good, but they blew it with the music.  Sorry guys, you can't have it both ways...either serve $16 entrees comprising a few beets scattered on a plate (very good) or try to be down to earth, but don't try to do both.
author: Tuhin R.

description: nice open kitchen, fun to watch the cooks quietly fuss. they are calm about it but they sure are fussy about the food, how it tastes and how it looks. the prix fixe is full of surprises. if there is a yolk it is a treat. if there is a pea it is a tiny flavor wonder.
author: Fzarond K.

description: the food quality is on par with any top rated restaurants in the city. our waitresses were very nice and warm. however, they are charging fine dining service prices ($89 tasting + $50 wine pairing) but did not deliver (not even close). food is solid 4 stars and service is a weak 3 stars. i would come back again for the food but not for the service.
author: Nikko Q.
